title: 'PM Modi's first press conference - two questions only'. What would the questions be?
selftext:
If you had the chance to ask these questions, what would be the two questions you asked? Wrong answers also accepted. 


---------------


*From the Mint Article*

"In a rare press conference, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will take limited questions from journalists in the US following his speech alongside US President Joe Biden.

According to The White House, "They are likely to take questions from journalists. Normally each side takes two questions, but sometimes it can be one from each side. During the last Indian State Visit of former prime minister Manmohan Singh in November 2009, the two sides took one question each."


----------------
comments: *prime minister do you like eating chocolate chocolate chip?*

India reporter: Would you like Adani to invest in USA? Also, did you request Elon Musk to launch Tesla in India so elites kids can buy it and flaunt in school?

USA reporter: Why are you on a state trip when one of your state, I think it's called MANIPUR burning ?
The American reporters will most likely be muzzled from asking important questions too. I will be very surprised if something controversial is asked.
1) Where dis you buy your yoga pants? 2) How much the the Indian Tax Payer pay for the massive Government Airplane? 3) Who does your hair?
What do you think of Lab Grown Chicken?
Well, he lit the fuse himself during the last elections to win them so... ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Is it the US version of "Melody itni chocolaty kyon hai"? ü§î
Yeah, very very unlikely. Also, not really sure if it will even happen
Well Patanjali has opened a new clothing and hair style salon called "Indie Fakeeri" soon going to open a store in Times Squareü•≥‚ú®
We need to hype this up. Thank you USA for Modi Interview.

The joke is on the Indian Delegation,  those huge mushrooms were flown in express and direct from China..Sourced on AliBaba, delivery international via Amazon Express and locally via Skip The Dishes. ..
.
